intro: Lagenandra praetermissa, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by fluffy, white seed heads that aid in wind dispersal. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Lagenandra praetermissa is often found in sandy soils and is a common component of dry grassland ecosystems.
